items.title: Complex Chaos thinks AI can help people find common ground
items.summary: The startup uses an LLM tailored to helping people arrive at a consensus. Is it enough to help bridge our differences?

items.title: NZXT’s gaming mouse pads are up to 67% off ahead of fall Prime Day sale, starting from just $10
items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find a handful of NZXT gaming mouse pads discounted right now, with prices starting from just $9.99 Prime shipped. Folks without a Prime membership can check out with items worth over $35 in the cart. The brand’s Zone mouse pads, including the standard Zone and Zone Elite Premium XXL models, are discounted right now with up to 67% off. Best Buy is matching the prices for most of these models, along with a few other variants, and these are the lowest prices we have tracked for them to date. Head below for more details.

items.summary: Over the past weekend at the Tokyo Game Show, GameSir demonstrated a new controller that turns your smartphone into a Game Boy. items.title: Google rolls out its new gradient "G" icon company-wide, saying it "now represents all of Google ... and visually reflects our evolution in the AI era" (Abner Li/9to5Google)
items.summary:
Abner Li / 9to5Google:
Google rolls out its new gradient “G” icon company-wide, saying it “now represents all of Google ... and visually reflects our evolution in the AI era”  —  After introducing for Google Search in May, the gradient ‘G’ icon will now be used across the company.

items.title: UK government bails out Jaguar Land Rover with £1.5B loan after hack disrupts vehicle production for weeks
items.summary: The Indian-owned carmaking giant will be bailed out after a cyberattack stalled car production and its downstream supply chain. Critics argue that the bailout sends the wrong message to hackers and crime groups.

items.title: The TechCrunch Disrupt Stage revealed: Behold the first look
items.summary: The Disrupt Stage is where tech’s biggest bets get made — live and unfiltered. It’s where startup dreams turn into $100,000 wins in Startup Battlefield, and where the industry’s power players reveal what’s next. Register to save up to $444 on your pass.

items.title: Ford’s CEO isn’t impressed with Apple CarPlay Ultra
items.summary: The list of car companies looking askance at Apple’s newly release, all-encompassing version of CarPlay is growing longer. After years of teasing, Apple launched the CarPlay Ultra earlier this […]

items.title: Google’s gradient ‘G’ logo is rolling out everywhere

The new logo first began to surface across the Google app on Android and iOS in May, but soon, the design will begin to appear across all of the company’s platforms, marking Google’s first big logo change in 10 […]

We caught an early deal on it in the $35 range recently, but the longer 2-meter model has now fallen down to $29 with free shipping for Prime members or in orders over $35 – you can land the 2-meter model for $10 less than the 1-meter right now with this deal.

items.title: Young protesters in Madagascar renew demands for water and power
items.summary: ANTANANARIVO (Reuters) -Police in Madagascar's capital fired teargas on Monday at thousands of people who returned to the streets for a third round of youth-led protests against water and power cuts, with many calling for the government's resignation. Read full story

items.title: Marissa Mayer will close her old AI startup, sell assets to her new AI startup
items.summary: Former Yahoo CEO Marissa Meyer is closing the doors on her consumer software startup Sunshine, and is selling the company's assets to her new AI startup, Dazzle, Wired reported, citing an email sent to Sunshine's shareholders.

items.title: Microsoft launches Agent Mode in Excel and Word, using GPT-5 to generate complex spreadsheets and documents, saying it is "bringing vibe working" to 365 Copilot (Tom Warren/The Verge)
items.summary:
Tom Warren / The Verge:
Microsoft launches Agent Mode in Excel and Word, using GPT-5 to generate complex spreadsheets and documents, saying it is “bringing vibe working” to 365 Copilot  —  A new Agent Mode comes to Office apps today, alongside an Office Agent in Copilot chat.

items.title: MCMC to head delegation in Singapore for talks on curbing cybercrime, says Fahmi
items.summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) will spearhead a delegation to Singapore next week for technical discussions with international social media platforms regarding mechanisms to curb cybercrime. Read full story

items.title: Microsoft launches ‘vibe working’ in Excel and Word
items.summary: You’ve probably heard of vibe coding — novices writing apps by creating a simple AI prompt — but now Microsoft wants to introduce a similar thing for its Office apps. The software maker is launching a new Agent Mode in Excel and Word that can generate complex spreadsheets and documents with just a prompt. A […]

items.title: UK publishes new sanctions over Iran nuclear programme
items.summary: LONDON (Reuters) -The British government sanctioned dozens of Iranian-linked individuals and entities on Monday, following similar moves made by the United Nations and the European Union aimed at curbing what Britain described as Iran's nuclear proliferation efforts. Read full story

items.title: LEGO Horizon Adventures for Switch just hit the $24 Amazon all-time low, more
items.summary:
We are still tracking a number of Switch 1 and 2 game deals below, alongside pre-order offers on Kirby Air Riders and live listings for titles like Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2, and more. And now you can add a new Amazon all-time low on LEGO Horizon Adventures for Switch down at just $23.99 with free shipping for Prime members or in orders over $35 to the list – it is also matched at Walmart. This title carries a $60 list price but is more regularly found in the $40 range these days. Today’s deal undercuts the previous Amazon low by a couple bucks to deliver the best we have tracked there all-time for the Switch version – PS5 gamers will find this one for $22 Prime shipped at Woot.

As part of its early Prime Big Deal Days offers, Amazon is offering a bundle that gets you its Echo Frames 3rd Gen glasses down at $119.99 shipped. This is regularly a $350 bundle, which is now seeing a $230 discount. That’s $10 less than the previous all-time low and our mention from earlier this year. The Echo Frame sunglasses, which typically gofor up to $330, are separately down to $119.99 shipped today as well, which is the lowest we have seen them fetch to date. The Echo Spot smart speaker bundled with the glasses are worth $50, so you’re looking at up to $320 in value when paired with the blue light frames today.
